metadata.title: CVE-2023-4581 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Excel `.xll` add-in files did not have a blocklist entry in Firefox'sexecutable blocklist which allowed them to be downloaded without anywarning of their potential harm. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 117,Firefox ESR < 102.15, Firefox ESR < 115.2, Thunderbird < 102.15, andThunderbird < 115.2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4581` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 117.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 117.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 117.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.15.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.15.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.15.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.15.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.15.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.15.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '117.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.15.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
